did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: 8.6 cubic feet; 1 map case folder; 1 box of c. 36 rolled drawings.
Correspondence, drawings, published articles, manuscripts, biographical material, photoprints and negatives, and sketches.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, drawings, published articles, manuscripts of books and articles, biographical material, photoprints and negatives, and sketches; drawings, plans and sketches pertain to various work executed by Weber, particularly for Arrowsmith.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence; drawings and sketches; published articles and manuscripts of books and articles; biographical material; certificates and diplomas; and photographs, slides, and negatives. Drawings, plans and sketches pertain to various work executed by Weber, particularly for Arrowsmith. Slides include pictures of plants and gardens, travel views, including slides of a trip to the Galapagos, and family images. Also 3x5 cards describing varieties of plants. Illustrations to Weber's lectures on geomorphology.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Nelva Weber papers, #4840. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Mss.: The Designer in the Garden
Lecture: Earth is Our Home - Natural Landscapes

scopecontent.p: Includes: Arrowsmith, Bane, Becker, Chamberlin, Cornell, Gwinner (Gewinner), Hatmaker, Meyer, Weber families. One letter dated 1868. Research is from about 1946-1959.
